"Set whether to enable NVIDIA Deep Learning Super Sampling.

With DLSS enabled, your game is rendered at a lower resolution, then AI is used to upscale it to a higher one, to get the highest possible framerate with the best possible graphics settings.

※You can only use DLSS if you have an NVIDIA RTX graphics card."

"Set whether to automatically send newly-acquired Material items to Material Storage, if Material Storage is available.

・Trial rewards
・Task/Quest rewards
・Mission Pass rewards
・Scratch bonus rewards"

"Set whether to enable AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution 1.0.

With FSR 1.0 enabled, your game is rendered at a lower resolution, then upscaled to a higher one, to get the highest possible framerate with the best possible graphics settings.

※You can only use FSR 1.0 if you have a graphics card that supports it."

"Streamer Mode is a setting that hides the Chat and other information while you're sharing a screen/streaming.

While Streamer Mode is active, some Settings are automatically enabled. You can view which Settings are enabled via the Options."

"Set whether to automatically reply to other players who try to send you Whisper Chats when you have Whisper Chat disabled.

Reply Phrase 1: [Automated Response] Whisper Chat is unavailable for this player.
Reply Phrase 2: [Automated Response] Whisper Chat cannot be used as this player is in Streamer Mode."

"$(0)

Cannot be changed while in Streamer Mode."

"A shading & rendering effect that adds additional shadows around your character.

Setting this to OFF will improve performance."

"Sets whether to enable HDR (High Dynamic Range).

To use HDR, you must first have an HDR-capable monitor connected and enable this feature in your PC settings.
After completing this setup process, you will need to restart the game.

※When HDR is enabled, screenshots and video footage recorded from the game may appear differently from how the game itself looks."

"Adjusts screen brightness when HDR is enabled.

Adjust this setting until the symbol displayed on-screen is barely visible."

"Adjusts how bright the brightest parts of the screen will be when HDR is enabled.

Adjust this setting until the symbol displayed on-screen is barely visible."
"Adjusts how vivid colors are when HDR is enabled."

"Set whether to use a feature that makes player and party character movements appear more natural.

If character movement appears unnatural, setting this to OFF may resolve the issue."

"Set whether to display Symbol Arts in My Shop.

※If set to \"Hide\", Symbol Arts set in other players' My Shops will not be displayed."

"Sets how characters appear when their detailed model cannot be displayed.

[Model 1] Displays as a silhouette.
[Model 2] Displays as a white model.
[Model 3] Displays as a semi-transparent model.

※Setting to Model 3 may impact performance slightly."

"Sets whether to enable Magnifier Mode.

※If enabled, you can activate Magnifier Mode with + ."

"Sets the maximum number of simultaneous notifications to display
at the bottom of the screen when completing a goal of a Task."

"Sets the size of the damage numbers displayed when
your character deals damage to enemies."

"Sets the size of the damage numbers displayed when
Party Members deal damage to enemies."

"Sets the size of the damage numbers displayed when
other characters deal damage to enemies."

"Sets the size of the numbers displayed when your character
takes damage from enemies or recovers their HP."

"Sets the size of the numbers displayed when Party Members
take damage from enemies or recover their HP."

"Sets the size of the numbers displayed when other characters
take damage from enemies or recover their HP."

"Sets whether to highlight the damage number displayed
when your character deals a Critical Hit to enemies.

[Highlight 1]
The numbers will be enlarged.

[Highlight 2]
The numbers will be enlarged and an effect will be added."

"Sets whether to display Login Calls from other players.

※If you select \"Hide\", all Login Calls will be hidden.

※To receive Login Calls from a player, select them from your Friend List, then select \"Receive Login Calls\"."

"Sets whether to automatically Lock-On to another enemy after defeating your current Lock-On target.

※You can use the \"Lock-On Target Direction\" setting to determine which enemy will be chosen."

"Sets whether to display Portable Holograms placed by other players.

※If you select \"Display\", the number of Portable Holograms shown will vary based on your Detailed Model Count setting.

※If you switch this setting from \"Do not display\" to \"Display\", other players' Portable Holograms will begin to appear after you move Sections."

"Sets whether to reduce the frequency at which the appearance of other characters and distant enemies is updated.

※Selecting \"Enable\" will lighten the load on your computer's hardware."

"Sets whether other players within a given distance will be displayed using the Texture Resolution setting chosen under Graphics.

※The number of players displayed in high resolution will vary depending on your system.

※Selecting \"Use\" will increase processing load."

"Sets whether to show characters, costumes etc. in a cartoony visual style.

※Selecting \"Enable\" will increase the load on your computer."

"Sets how much to highlight the outlines of characters when Toon Display is enabled.

※Lowering this will lighten the processing load."
"Sets how dark shadows should be when Toon Display is enabled."

"Sets whether to display the average damage per second (DPS) you have dealt to the target enemy.

※Displayed in the upper right corner of the screen."

"Sets whether to show other players' characters in a cartoony visual style.

If set to \"Conform to character's setting\", the cartoon style will only be applied to players who have set their own character to be drawn that way.

※Selecting anything other than \"Do Not Display\" will increase the load on your computer."

"Sets whether to show NPCs in a cartoony visual style.

※Selecting \"Enable\" will increase the load on your computer."

"Sets whether to attempt to make player character movement look more natural.

If your character's movements appear unnatural, setting this to OFF may make them look better."

"Sets whether to display an icon
confirming whether or not the character's
current fashion and equipment are permitted in
events such as screenshot campaigns.

※Icon is always shown in the upper-right corner of the screen.

[Displayed Icons]
・: Items are appropriate
・: One or more items are not permitted"
"Sets the position of your DPS (Damage Per Second) display."

"Sets whether to display the control guide for the Auto Party Join system while waiting for an Emergency Quest or while a PSE Burst is occurring.

If you follow the instructions this control guide displays, you will join a Party formed from other players who have also enabled Auto Party Join.

※This control guide will not be displayed if you already have Auto Party Join enabled."

"Sets whether to always have the Auto Party Join setting enabled under Party Settings.

※Changing this setting also changes the normal Auto Party Join checkbox.
※However, this setting will not affect the Party's settings if you are not the Party Leader."

"アクションパートの操作方法について、
従来の2ボタンタイプとは異なる
新たな3ボタンタイプが選択可能です。

3ボタンタイプではより直感的な操作で
アクションが行えます。
この設定は、「オプション」の「設定の初期化」から
いつでも変更することができます。

どちらの操作タイプを使用しますか？"

"You can change your control settings
based on what you primarily use.

[If Keyboard & Mouse]
- Keyboard to move, Mouse to
attack & control the camera

[If Gamepad]
- Gamepad to move,
attack & control the camera
- Direct chat with a keyboard

From the \"Main Menu\", go to \"System\",
then \"Control Settings\", & \"Primary Input Method\"."

"This will reset all options.

"Are you sure you want to discard changes?"

"This will reset all windows to their initial positions and default sizes.
Are you sure you wish to continue?"
"This will reset the size and location of all windows."
